uniol.apt.analysis.cycles.lts

Class ComputeSmallestCyclesJohnson

  • java.lang.Object
    • uniol.apt.analysis.cycles.lts.AbstractComputeSmallestCycles
      • uniol.apt.analysis.cycles.lts.ComputeSmallestCyclesJohnson
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ComputeSmallestCycles

    class ComputeSmallestCyclesJohnson
extends AbstractComputeSmallestCycles
    Compute smallest cycles or cycles which do not contain any state twice via Johnson's algorithm. This implementation is based on "Finding All the Elementary Circuits of a Directed Graph" from Donald B. Johnson in SIAM J. Comput., 4(1), 77â€“84. (8 pages) (DOI: 10.1137/0204007).
    Author:
    vsp

      • computePVsOfSmallestCycles

        public java.util.Set<Pair<java.util.List<java.lang.String>,ParikhVector>> computePVsOfSmallestCycles(TransitionSystem ts,
                                                                                                     boolean smallest)
        Computes the parikh vectors of all smallest cycles of a labeled transition system with a algorithm using Johnson's algorithm. (Requirement A10)
        Specified by:
        computePVsOfSmallestCycles in interface ComputeSmallestCycles
        Specified by:
        computePVsOfSmallestCycles in class AbstractComputeSmallestCycles
        Parameters:
        ts - - the transitionsystem to examine.
        smallest - - flag which tells if really all or just the smallest should be saved. (Storage vs. Time)
        Returns:
        a list of the smallest cycles of a given transitionsystem an their parikh vectors.
